I do not have personal experience, but here is what i know: 

flight attendants receive extensive training from their airline before they can start working in the aircraft cabins. they typically undergo several weeks of training that includes simulations of emergency situations.

during training, they learn about the procedures that should be followed during a variety of emergency situations, such as engine failure, fires, turbulence, and medical emergencies. they learn how to use emergency equipment and how to communicate effectively with the crew and passengers.

the training also includes first-aid certification, self-defense techniques, and how to handle unruly passengers. in addition to this, the flight attendants also receive recurrent training at regular intervals to ensure that they are up to date with the latest safety protocols and emergency procedures.
